info.title: Text Analysis
info.description: AYLIEN Text API is a package of Natural Language Processing, Information Retrieval and Machine Learning tools that allow developers to extract meaning and insights from documents with ease.

get.description: Extracts the main body of article, including embedded media such as images & videos from an URL and removes all the surrounding clutter.

parameters.name: best_image
parameters.description: Extract the best image of the article

get.description: Tracking the progress, and status of a batch job.

post.description: Accepts, and queues a job for batch processing.

get.description: Classifies a piece of text according to IPTC NewsCode standard into more than 500 categories.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Language of text. Valid options are: "en", "de", "fr", "es", "it", "pt", and "auto". If you set the value "auto", it'll try to detect the language. Default value is "en".

get.description: Extracts named entities mentioned in a document, disambiguates and cross-links them to DBPedia and Linked Data entities, along with their semantic types (including DBPedia and schema.org).

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Language of text. Valid options are: en, de, fr, es, it, pt, and auto. If you set the value "auto", it'll try to detect the language. Default value is en.

get.description: Extracts named entities (people, organizations and locations) and values (URLs, emails, telephone numbers, currency amounts and percentages) mentioned in a body of text.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Language of text. Valid options are: en, de, fr, es, it, pt, and auto. If you set the value "auto", it'll try to detect the language. Default value is en.

get.description: Detects the main language a document is written in and returns it in ISO 639-1 format, from among 62 different languages.
Returns phrases related to the provided unigram, or bigram.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of entries in response. Default is 20, and max is 100.

get.description: Detects sentiment of a document in terms of polarity ("positive" or "negative") and subjectivity ("subjective" or "objective").
Summarizes an article into a few key sentences.

parameters.name: sentences_number
parameters.description: Number of sentences to be returned in "default" mode  (not applicable to "short" mode). Default value is "5" sentences.

parameters.name: sentences_percentage
parameters.description: Percentage of sentences to be returned in "default" mode (not applicable to "short" mode). Possible values are 1 - 100.
